field.name: description
field.p: (A). A network operating system, the users access remote resources in the same manner as local resources.
(B). In a distributed operating system, the user can access remote resources either by logging into the appropriate remote machine or transferring data from the remote machine to their own machine.
field.h3: Which of the statements is true?

record.field: C. Both A and B false
2. Number of CPU register in a system depends on _____
3. Distributed OS works on the _____ principle
4. Which amongst the following is not an advantage of Distributed systems?
5. If one site fails in distributed system _____
A. The remaining sites can continue operating
B. All the sites will stop working
C. Directly connected sites will stop working
B. Every system in the network
C. Both and every system on the network
7. Which technique is based on compile-time program transformation for accessing remote data in a distributed-memory parallel system.
8. Logical extension of computation migration is _____
9. Processes on the remote systems are identified by _____
10. Which routing technique is used in a distributed system?
11. In distributed systems, link and site failure is detected by _____
12. What is not true about the distributed system?
A. It is a collection of processor
C. They do not share memory
13. What are characteristics of processors in distributed systems?
A. They vary in size and function
B. They are same in size and function
C. They manufactured with single purpose
14. What are characteristics of distributed file systems?
A. Its users, servers and storage devices are dispersed
B. Service activity is not carried out across network
C. FaThey have single centralized data repositorytigue
D. There are multiple dependent storage devices
15. How are access to resources of various machines done?
A. Remote logging using ssh or telnet
B. Zone are configured for automatic access
16. What design features of a communication network are important?
17. How are collisions avoided in a network?
A. Carrier sense with multiple access (CSMA), collision detection (CD)
B. Carrier sense multiple access with collision avoidance
18. What is a common problem found in distributed systems?
19. What are the important steps followed when recovery from failure happens?
A. Post repairing integration with main system should happen smoothly and gracefully
B. Upon link failure both parties at end must not be notified
C. Fault recovery system must be adjusted
20. What are the different ways in which clients and servers are dispersed across machines?
A. Servers may not run on dedicated machines
B. Servers and clients can be on same machines
C. Distribution cannot be interposed between a OS and file system
D. OS cannot be distributed with the file system a part of that distribution
21. Which of the following distribution systems is more reliable?
22. Which of the following distribution systems is the most economical?
23. In a distribution system major cost is that of _____
24. In the design of a distributor which of the following is the major consideration?
25. Corona occurs between two transmission conductors when they _____
26. Compared with a solid conductor of the same radius, corona appears on a stranded conductor at a lower voltage, because stranding
B. Make the current flow spirally about the axis of the conductor
C. Produces oblique sections to a plane perpendicular to a axis of the conductor
D. Produces surfaces of smaller radius
27. The good effect of corona on overhead lines is to _____
A. Less than that in AC line operating at same rms voltage
B. More than that in AC line at same rms voltage
C. Same as in AC linear equal rms voltage
28. The area of cross-section of the neutral in a 3-wire D.C. system is generally _____ the area of cross section of main conductor
29. For the given distribution system the maximum voltage at the midpoint will be _____
30. A DC 2-wire system with mid-point earthed having cross-sectional area of each conductor be a and resistance R1. If this is replaced by monopolar system, then saving of copper will be
